oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Children Undergoing Intravenous Placement in the Pediatric Emergency Department: Distraction to Reduce Pain and Distress
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ali, Samina
Hartling, Lisa
Curtis, Sarah
Scott, Shannon
Beran, Tanya
Dow, Nadia
Rajagopal, Manasi
Graham, Timothy
Jou, Hsing
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This study will test if iPads are useful to help lower pain and distress for children who are visiting an emergency department and need an intravenous line put in. The results from this study could be important for many children receiving medical care, as distraction is safe and the use of iPads is enjoyable for many children.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences

oai_dc:dc.dc:type: Questionnaire data; Observational data; Audiovisual data; Clinical data
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Observed Scale of Behavioral Distress-Revised (OSBD-R); Faces Pain Scale-Revised (FPS-R); State Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI-S, Form Y)
